gq2bTCrWy7ynIvsdfsWSmA.text: First time visiting Fin and Fino and it was a great experience.  The online menu is only a sampling of what they serve so don't be discouraged if you don't see many options to choose from.  We split about 7 or 8 plates and they were fresh, creatively prepared, and tasty. The server was friendly, knowledgeable, and checked on us throughout the night as we kept ordering. The atmosphere was spacious and clean.  The only thing I wish they would improve is the wine list.  What's up with these below par wines that no one has ever heard of and can't even be purchased in wine stores??  Rebranded leftovers sold cheap by distributors I suppose.

eQQZa8bJZRfU4C5aL_DKfw.text: Two stars.  Not because of the staff. Not because of the atmosphere or the absolutely amazing location and the food presentation is superb! Now the big question is the TASTE...definitely subpar!  First, my family ordered the banh mi shrimp, and as a Vietnamese person, I was expecting a toasted French baguette with shrimp in the middle.  I was totally wrong when it showed up. It was more of a banh mi-less shrimp (bread less) but they call it banh mi shrimp!  Nonetheless it tasted liked grill shrimp - OK.  Secondly, the skirt steak, presentation amazing but the the chef was too generous on the salt with it! Wayyy too salty!!! Cut it back like 10 notches chef! We also ordered the smoked salmon which was also salty! I gotta to admit, the place is fancy but the food needs to cut back on the salt! I think I got hypertension now. Overall superb staff, beautiful location but salty food!

AByNeRZMtYMro14EMcsYIA.text: Fantastic restaurant!  Love the ambience and vibe.  Our favs were the scallops, angel oysters and the lemon olive oil dessert. Mussels were amazing. Violin Pino Noir was fantastic too.  Our server (Charles) was top notch. Best dining experience  I've had in CLT.  Bravo in food, service and overall!  See you again soon.

lHYzuZrQ7DfwH63E-zcoRg.text: Late post. I was visiting downtown Charlotte and had a shitty day. I decided to walk to a closest restaurant (obviously good rated) and came across Fin & Fino. Loved the food. Since, I was bit upset, I asked the bartender to make me a cocktail which is not sweet and strong. I don't remember the name or never asked but cocktail was AWESOME. Bartender had a great attitude and everyone seem friendly. Food & service on point and above expectations. Definitely, would be returning for some more. I would highly recommend this place if you looking for tasty food, strong flavorful cocktail and great service!

Jm7thVmFxWI1Buz826XNyg.text: Go check it out. Been there twice in the two weeks they have been open and I would recommend "the treatment" they roll out a bunch of different features of the menu to provide a melody of holy goodness. I am talking everything from oysters, homemade pasta, gnocchi, duck, quail, steak, you name it they do it, and do it well!! Don't forget the final course is dessert. I would personally recommend the cheesecake.   If you want to make it saucy, get a wine tasting/whole glass with each course they bring, it will make the experience all the more amazing.   Keep kicking ass Fin and Fino.

_2twhPhTKlW2rwXjfNbyfQ.text: This place was incredible! Upon walking in the atmosphere was inviting and the open kitchen dining room made you feel like you were part of the kitchen.  We decided to go with the Treatment at the recommendation of our server Boston. Special Thanks to Boston for your amazing service. You helped guide us through a True culinary experience, the octopus was cooked to perfection, your recommendations of wine pairings with the entree selections were on point! And let's not forget the cheesecake, WOW! This is the best cheesecake I have ever had! Thanks to all at Fin and Fino especially Boston for such a memorable evening.

2LfB6CN3VLtzrIA3ZNtPAg.text: My current favorite place in Charlotte for dinner. The atmosphere is gorgeous - airy and light with a nice view into the kitchen. The drinks from BK & The Clams are top notch, I'm never disappointed in their cocktails! And the food... oh my heavens so good. I love oysters and theirs are incredible! You have to try The Treatment- you get to try a few dishes and part of your money goes to charity. Love this place!

O7hbdrX6s2YLzuAM8EaATg.text: Great atmosphere, great food, great cocktails, awesome service and all at a really good price point! This may be one of my new favorites in Charlotte.

6SjlZ_UdSXoxnQHOESnCPQ.text: While I haven't written any reviews in a little while, my visit to Fin & Fino has inspired me. I knew that they were opening sometime soon but I needed a hot tip from a friend last Saturday to know that they were opening essentially last weekend. Now the wife and I love all things seafood, so we were excited to try it all. Well her lobster allergy precludes her from trying all but Fin & Fino was very accommodating.  The menu is a little overwhelming with almost too many dishes to count to go along with dare I say the largest oyster list in the city. We both love raw oysters so we decided on 4 different varieties of north east oysters. We liked them salty and briny and they were. We followed those with some salmon and tuna poke which was well done with balanced flavors showcasing the fishies. Now for the next choices our server helped us and suggested that we do another small plate and share an entree. We obliged and agreed upon the scallops and latke, more on those later and the monkfish entree which while it came with a lobster sauce, they were able to plate the dish with the sauce on the side to avoid any need for an epipen, cause those are expensive, or a visit to the ER, cause that's even more expensive. The monkfish was cooked well and the tomatoes and kale were great accompaniments. Now onto the scallops and latkes. This was hands down my favorite dish of the night, while the wife may have another ultimate favorite we both agreed that the scallops/latkes were Charleston great. Trust us that's a thing. I try hard at home to cook scallops properly, sometimes they turn out better than others, but these scallops were probably the best I can remember. And the pairing of the scallops with the latkes along with the sour cream and lemon curd, at least I thought it was lemon curd was over the top. In fact when it came to dessert, we both decided to forgo the sweets and order each another small plate. The wife got the buckwheat pasta with shrimp and I, well I got another order of those scallops...  I would be remiss if I didn't mention the drinks and the bar. While we didn't hang out at the bar at all, it looks very well laid out and the drinks that we had were interesting and delicious. If you trust the bartender, try their "waiting for magic" offering which changes daily with unknown ingredients or get a drink off the menu or even go off menu, they will make you something good. They also have an extensive wine list if that's more your thing. The wife and I will be regulars, and they will be offering lunch as well as happy time from 4-6, which our server mentioned to us is still a work in progress on the full details. The price point is elevated a little, but if you don't like raw oysters and drink less than we do, you will be fine.

BOuPScISJyiZ4TndvRLzrg.text: My friend and I came here for dinner and we loved it! We are both not picky and so we went for the Treatment where our server picked several items from the menu for us to try and a portion of the cost goes to charity. It was like a delicious seafood journey! Service was impeccable and the restaurant itself was beautiful. I even loved the hand soap in the bathroom (I think it was a little minty). There is valet parking and parking on the street.

Acb6qvuRqWRDVMCgyL1pCw.text: For lunch I ordered the Crab Cake BLT (pork belly, green tomato relish, bibb lettuce) that comes with a side salad (local greens, caramelized apples, tomme cheese, lardons, candied pistachios, citrus-fennel vinaigrette.)  Absolutely delicious!!  The portions are just the right size, although I wish I had more salad. :)  I can't wait to return for dinner. I'm excited about the oysters.

TQrM_Y1xU51440QgnH71mA.text: Was not sure what to expect but was very pleasantly surprise... I sat at the bar and was immediately greeted and had great personalized attention throughout the night. The wine list is not your typical and if you're adventurous and want to try new grapes from all over the world this is the place. The seafood menu goes well with the wine list and the portions are perfect and delicious. Highly recommend this place. Dishes I tried were: Arctic Char Ceviche, Ahi Poke, Smoked Oysters, Cobia Crudo and Seared Tuna. All very well done. I look forward to coming back. Tks Tim and crew.

bIb-t8r5HHs7qgRZU9GA4g.text: Stumbled upon Fin & Fino on a foggy Monday night, shortly after landing in Charlotte. The scallop and latke was the my favorite thing hands down. The scallop was perfectly seared with a salty crust, and came with a sweet puree and sour cream to bring a little creaminess and sweetness to the dish. The baked oysters were a close second. Also loved the olive oil pound cake - very lemony and just the right amount of denseness, accompanied by ice cream and whipped cream. The service was impeccable.

Ubgya-93wov17PNDVDN-xA.text: High hopes for Fin & Fino and, for the most part, it didn't disappoint.   Love the space and the build out-very tastefully done with lots of blue hues- nautical theme but not in a kitschy way.  Bar is very cool as well- good spot to saddle up for a drink and some small plates.   One rub is that with the open floor plan the decibel level is pretty high. Was difficult to hear anyone but the person next to you (we had a party of six) and dining room was only half full. Buyer beware. However, they were playing cool tunes from the 90's so that took the edge off..  On to the food. Some hits, some misses. Fried oysters were fantastic-great texture and perfectly cooked. Same with the Bahn Mi shrimp- great balance of heat and cool and a good mix of fresh veggie crunch that defines that sandwich. Mussels were a big hit as well- everyone was gaga over the broth and we needed extra orders of bread to sop up every last drop. Hanger steak was very good as well. Worth an order.   Now some of the clunkers... calamari was a bit bland and over cooked however will admit that we asked for it "naked" so the aioli may have saved it. Smoked salmon flatbread was bland- arugula salad on top needed some seasoning but that may not have salvaged it. Just blah. Grilled oysters were also flavorless- needed salt badly and the heat from the japs was lost in kind of a pool of nothingness. Faroe Island Salmon was steady but a bit over cooked on both our orders (which is a shame b/c that salmon is so damn good medium rare).  Service was very attentive and knowledgeable. A bit slow at times but not an issue at all.   Would certainly return and is a refreshing addition to the Charlotte dining scene.

EZj2c9bSfz2Hh-jiYjItTg.text: I came here for my birthday and my husband I did the chef tasting. It was worth the money and more than enough food. They asked if we had any food allergies and curated our menu. Everything we tried was delicious. The highlights for me was curry octopus and sausage dish, a deconstructed bahn mi shrimp dish and an off the menu Mahi mahi that was cooked to perfection... it came with a hazelnut gnocchi that was to die for! I highly recommend this place and hope to go back soon!

sB9pbQUBb5kRw502ezHLIQ.text: Went here for New Years, it was awesome! The drinks we're amazing, from coffee cocktails to nuts and Berry's, very on point. The fish dish tower was very good, best lobster I have had. Sara the manager was very accommodating and made our experience superb. Will be back for sure!

k03CiSD5It-sytdyXNZRFg.text: Loved this place! Every single aspect of our experience was exceptional right down to the smile on our waitress' face.  Food was incredible, we all had the chefs Treat. The Wagyu skirt steak was tasty like nobody's business.

mc8gHasnixvwH76MbZGeYw.text: Very friendly staff! Amazing food! Great atmosphere!  Looking from the outside in, you would think is a fresh, clean, new restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised that it was so much more. The whole menu looks enticing and inviting, and you just want to try everything.  We had the salmon tuna poke bowl, hanger steak, calamari, broccoli, several types of oysters from all over the country, goat cheese and beet salad, cheesecake and a few drinks including a 20 year old scotch (a gift from the table next to us).  They've been open for 3 months but it feels like they've been here, waiting for me, my whole life.  The overall hospitality made us feel like we were the only ones in the room. I think we'll definitely date them again.

k25rPU-CUQLbJ02E-Eqp8g.text: Great atmosphere when you sit at the bar. Great oysters. The veggie sides are good. The quail was mediocre, small, and very dry. Would not order that again. But great place to go for oysters and drinks.

n7RfxwufOU1eocU16TK-Cw.text: Andrew "sarge" was a GREAT server. He was knowledgeable on wines and very dish. He provided  a lightheartedness and attentive service!  The food was plate licking good and the atmosphere was clean and refreshing. A new Charlotte favorite!

D4cOfz0ZekgP3QcDvVIVCw.text: Excellent restaurant! I've gone here several times and especially enjoyed the Treatment and the Call of the Clam. You've got to choose these options for an amazing experience.  Btw ask for Earl.

ua825LlGDJ73fjk9Tmr3SQ.text: Phenomenal restaurant and staff. Kim & John and associates did it again.  Fresh seafood and a flair from chef Ryan and his staff make this an intense & satisfying dining experience.  Consistent team service as at the other Rare Root establishments not to mention delectable dessert and cocktail offerings.   Definitely one of my favs.

CBUp6WKYx6c1n2GOCHXDCw.text: Deserves every star. Everything is primo from the service to the decor and of course the food.

g5aJsN6rQtpuaMu5epvELw.text: Came in for a glass of wine and dinner; had to ask for a menu; they got one to me; and I sat......and sat........and sat......and raised my hand.......and tried to get their attention and finally left and went to 204 North because I was hungry; my only question is why I gave them 2 stars  Still waiting to pay my bill; lowered my rating to one star!!  My only question is why I gave them any?

xRD6O641S5BfIgTuTHAKpQ.text: Excellent service, excellent food! The chef has done an amazing job, the seasoning was perfect,  the menu offers a variety of well prepared food. The best foie gras, it took us back to Paris. Our server had an excellent knowledge of the menu and was able to provide us with an in depth glimpse of what to expect from the dishes we were interested in. A definite recommend, we will be back!

eg_GLD19DMD2ECNI7KJGeA.text: after reading all the reviews we definitely were let down. we came on the Tuesday night before Valentine's day.   -highlights: the gnocchi & oysters (amazing) and scallops (also amazing), and the oysters with the jalapenos  -middle of the road: octopus(would not get again).  -low points: the risotto (NO salt, I can't believe the person running the pass let it out of the kitchen. no quality control here). the lamb was a major disappointment. was supposed to be served medium according to server, came out medium well and lacking flavor. it was sliced when brought to the table, so no guessing on the temp before it was served (again, quality control???) had a few other things but the ones not mentioned I can't think of (not memorable)  our server was nice but VERY slow. I sat without a drink for 15 minutes, while he was just standing around talking to co workers. unfortunate when you can't get good service and food on a weeknight. maybe this place puts more care and attention into everything on the weekends. at least I would hope.   I know this review seems extra, but after spending $180 for 2 people...yikes. 2.5/5

8N1EZuztn_Xx8ZKUDfNxgQ.text: What started out as a negative experience at Sea Level NC, ended up being a blessing in disguise because we quickly were able to reserve online at Fin & Fino & enjoy this new extraordinary gem. This was our first time at Fin & Fino and our server, Boston, did a phenomenal job from beginning to end. She was extremely helpful in familiarizing us with the menu and making recommendations . We enjoyed a dozen amazing oysters, scallops, salmon and dessert... everything was delicious. This is a refreshing new spot in Uptown and we look forward to returning soon! Thank you for the warm welcome and excellent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

hSQABWjsoC2liyXM05qg9w.text: This spot is a much needed for a barren restaurant area in uptown. The space itself is spacious, well designed and beautiful.   The food is innovative, fresh and delish. The staff is  knowledgeable about the menu. I also appreciated the fact that on a busy Saturday night, they had a well staffed bar where you never had a wait. (Take note other restaurants, 5 bartenders is definitely how you do it!)  As someone who was finishing Whole30 and ventured out anyway, the staff was kind and unbothered by my 15 questions. They made me several fantastic sugar free mocktails and didn't complain about the hassle. Very great experience!

dVuUQZeATifDZAqjZmTGRw.text: We went to Fin and Fino for restaurant week and the service was great, but the best part of the food was the dessert. We had read the reviews about the food and had high expectations going into the meal. We both really liked the food, but the scallops, shrimp, and mahi mahi were all a little spicy for our taste. They had run out of the berry crisp for dessert, so we got the cheesecake which was perfectly light and whipped. We also got the olive oil cake which was similar to strawberry shortcake, with pecan brittle and pickled strawberries. Dessert was definitely the highlight of the meal.

HNjmwZOw3uqXBz4j2Jbg-A.text: I had the pleasure of celebrating my brithday at fin & finio a few weeks ago and was blown away by the amazing cuzine & outstanding service! I highly recommend trying the bartender's choice for a cocktail, and the oysters are a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday dinner at Fin &amp; Fino =D
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love the attention to detail for my birthday dinner! Thank you F&amp;F
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious cocktails!

UcsZZHdeTeMk6bZC4afc_w.text: Was pleasantly surprised at their food. Had a great waiter. Very courteous and Super friendly. The food Comes out pretty fast!

1lSwMSbpe5y_-Dn7o-kfyA.text: We had The Treatment. $59/person and $5 of that goes to their preferred charity. Amazing! It was chefs choice and EVERYTHING was delicious. A combo of light seafood with incredibly robust, bold flavors. Our server also had excellent beer recommendations. Service was phenomenal throughout the evening. We highly recommend it!

JdyU7rTS_ejlvTGZUjhLEw.text: While I was in Charlotte this week, we decided to go to Fin & Fino as a co-worker of mine is related to the owner of the restaurant and he highly-recommended we dine there.  Boy, am I glad I listened to him!!    Fin & Fino is instantly one of my new favorite Charlotte restaurants!  EVERYTHING we tasted was amazing.  I absolutely love the concept of the small plates to share.  It's not exactly "tapas", but it is in the spirit of tapas.  Take my advice and try several different items.  My favorite was the scallop and latke dish.  I am going to have to get back to Charlotte quickly just to have that again.  If you love scallops, these are the most unique scallops you will ever eat and the presentation is phenomenal.    Our service was absolutely impeccable.  We never needed anything as everyone anticipated our needs very well and our server was as professional as it gets.  The restaurant is tastefully-decorated and, seriously, the bathroom soap was INCREDIBLE!  I know, right?  Soap??  They use a local company called Whispering Willow and I have already ordered some from their website.  I loved everything about this place.  Enjoy!

djWInOoh3EE-fVo1mTAGGw.text: Had a business lunch at high noon. Made a reservation but probably didn't need to. It was busy but not packed. Service was exceptional. Plenty of non seafood options on the menu but went with the crab cake BLT sandwich as did my guest. It was awesome. The crab cake stayed together nicely when you chomped into it. The bacon the sandwich was a good smokey addition. The BLT comes with a side apple salad which also has a little bacon it which made the salad. Perfect size for lunch. Hope to come back for dinner and try more.

4eCFYXlfTF1PnxQoC_OERg.text: We joined friends for dinner last night at Fin & Fino.  First time for us.  Also, full disclosure I am not typically a big seafood guy.  We had a great server, and service was excellent.  We started off with drinks, a few wine orders, cocktails and I went with the Cee-Lo Green.  It was described as some sort of chef's choice punch served in a fun glass.  Sounds great to me!  First glass came out and the punch had a coconut taste in a tiki glass.  Awesome.  Then we ordered a few apps - 12 choice oysters and an order of baked oysters.  All excellent.  The raw oysters were so fresh - it tasted like I had a mouthful of ocean water it was so salty and good.  We all decided to go with 'The Treatment'.  If you go here, do this!  Described as a tasting tour of the menu, we told our server that one of our guests can't have scallops, no raw items, etc.  For the next 2 hours we received food non-stop.  Red snapper, salmon, bone in NY Strip, scallops, shrimp, lobster pasta.  Every plate was excellent and when we thought it was over, more plates arrived.  Then there was the dessert course.  Cheesecake, chocolate tart and olive oil soaked pieces of cake with mascerated strawberries on top.  Overall great experience.

ppnINMJlDOijVGolVZlA0w.text: The restaurant is really cute, nice ambiance. The food was decent. Everything was a bit salty. Portions were good. Beer selection was lacking. Cocktails were just okay. My reason for the 2 stars is service. It was horrible! Our server's name was Boston. When we sat down it took her a while to come get our drinks. She was not friendly at all. She never introduced herself. She didn't explain the menu. She didn't seem familiar with the menu. When we asked for suggestions she basically said everything was good. She told us the portions were small tapas style but they were actually big enough for entrees. Needless to say we ordered too much food. All other staff were friendly. I expected a lot more for a $300 meal. Not likely to return.

CprLvSI7paR_0LXhkrefmw.text: We came here for dinner on a Thursday and were very impressed! My only regret is that we weren't hungry enough to do "the treatment" which is where you pay $50 per person and your server customizes a menu for your table. We ended up just getting a few small plates each and everything we tried was amazing. The scallops were fantastic and the poke bowl was delicious and surprisingly big! My friend decided to order the hanger steak, which we all poke fun at because it's a seafood restaurant, but it turned out to be incredible and one of the best things we tried! The tagliatelle was also very good and they give you a very big portion. Overall, we liked everything we tried! I was pleasantly surprised at the portion sizes because small plates tend to be tricky and sometimes end up being way too small. They also have an extensive wine list, but it's a tad confusing because it's grouped by what the wine will pair with and not the type of wine, so it's hard to tell what is red vs white, etc.  Overall, we really liked this place and definitely want to come back and to "the treatment"!

THEs_J7PmBB5rV9C2Jq1xA.text: After being an anonymous yelp user for the past 10 years I just had to come and do my first (and probably last) review. This place is amazing!   I was in town for business and really wanted seafood. Tyler, my waiter, spent time not only reviewing the menu but the dishes with best flavors. He told me to skip salad items. Im glad I listened.  I ordered the lobster and truffles and the Tile fish. The basil pasta, lobster, and truffle cream sauce in the lobster dish was so good that I saved a little bit as my last bite. I wanted it to be the last thing I tasted and remembered.   The Tile fish flavors were also great. It comes in a saffron broth with the charred corn, yellow sweet tomatoes and what i thought was jalapenos but was actually okra. Im not usually an okra fan but it is thinly sliced and works well with the dish.   I was surprised when the manager, Natalie, came by to ask how my meal was and later offered me complimentary dessert. I definitely appreciate the attentiveness shown.   I already recommended this place to 2 of my traveling colleagues. Im so jealous of all the locals who will get to enjoy this place whenever they want. Thank you Tyler, Natalie, and Fin and Fino for one of the most enjoyable meals and dining experiences I've ever had!   P.S There's an off menu item with butternut squash, mushrooms, and chicharrones, if i had room for more I would've gotten it. Ask about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tilefish. MMMM
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster and Truffles, ignore the spoon marks.

c5y3IM0Pxm238f9ONWNd0g.text: Fin and Fino had a few wins but overall a disappointing experience. The major issue is with regards to how they handled my food allergies; I was assured that all dishes I was served did would not include those items I'm allergic to. Five minutes after leaving the restaurant I knew hat wasn't the case and had a severe allergic reaction. Trusting that a restaurant is aware of the ingredients it's serving and is taking your health seriously is critically important. I'm not sure why this restaurant served me a dish with ingredients that I'm allergic to but it's unacceptable for any restaurant to do so.   Besides my allergy issue overall the interior/atmosphere is trendy and energetic. Wine list has some interesting bottles. Our server was attentive and seemed knowledgeable (I'm chalking the allergy issue to the kitchen, not her). The food was really the problem here. My husband was disappointed in his dishes, particularly the salmon flatbread and lobster and truffle; the flavors of truffle and salmon were lost in the other ingredients. I was served over cooked PEI mussels, half of which were inedible; because the dish was inedible they didn't charge me for it which I appreciated but the dish should never have been served. The fried oysters and beet salad were good, solid but nothing amazing.  I hope that Fin and Fino better accommodates those with food allergies going forward and focuses on improving the quality of its food. It has everything else going for it but due to the food experience we likely won't go back.

DRldH2Qernb1XHeO2dQuig.text: AMAZING!!!  I eat out multiple times a week while traveling for work and as a result am usually disappointed when trying a new restaurant.  Fin and Fino is one of the best places I've been to in a LONG time!    Took a friend here for her birthday and the "Treatment" is by far the best way to go!  $5 is donated to charity and it gives the most well rounded tour of the menu.  We had 7 small plate courses including oysters, shrimp, pork belly, beef, tuna tartare, scallops, fish and the most unbelievable cheesecake!!    Interior is well designed (minus the step when you first walk in) and spacious!  Seating is comfortable and service was excellent!   Take advantage of the option to reserve a table because this place isn't going to slow down any time soon!   Can't wait to go back!!

dlYGrxWNUDm60jeUgiFn7A.text: We had a 5 o'clock reservation that got cancelled on us. They did not call to tell us about this until we we're already at the restaurant 5 minutes before our reservation.

s74rr_0IXtd938t5TCPwlQ.text: Had a business lunch at Fin & Fini. Wonderful atmosphere for our conversation. Great staff. We both had the crab cake sandwich, which had a great tomato relish and fantastic lump crab cake. The side salad with mixed greens, apples, and shaved Parmesan was fantastic as well. A must stop in Downtown Charlotte.

pIiH5elxfFrXgajChUDNgQ.text: Came to Fin+Fino recently as an evacuee from Florence! What a fabulous experience! It was lunch.. but oh what a lunch!!!! Food and staff are outstanding! If in Charlotte...do yourself a favor!!

NIePZbZZM1SgYhWOYuTvOA.text: Such a great experience. We had a 830 reservation the other night, showed up almost 45 minutes early with the intention of just grabbing a drink or two at the bar,  but the hostesses were able to seat us immediately. Chris was our waiter, and he was awesome, great suggestions, no pressure, and just very good at engaging with us and making sure we had a good time. The drinks, which are all pirate themed, were awesome, expertly described and made very well.  Food wise: West coast oysters were on a Queens feast deal $2/oyster so we tried that---next time probably just pick our own specific ones Angel oysters---absolutely amazing and a must try Lobster with the shells and basil---again delicious, but there were no truffles on our dish Scallops and latkes---DEFINITELY recommend, great flavor and texture combinations Tilefish---good combo, but ours was a liiiiiitle under cooked/raw in the middle but we ate around it and was fine Of course, this being under the Dressler family of restaurants, we got a piece of cheesecake for dessert and left absolutely satisfied. I'd definitely recommend and ask if you can be in Chris's section!

RWlbyJ4T2pZ9glSxExpYmw.text: This place was really good. I had their calamari, husband got the mussles, I ordered this drink that came in a pineapple. This place makes you feel like you are dinning right by the beach. They have a good poke bowl and fresh oysters. I have also heard you should go with the chefs choice deal they have on the menu. I've heard nothing but great things about that if you like trying new foods that is the way to go.

F5ei5qjE4-gN0tiQPnvXFA.text: 4.5 Stars!  Great restaurant and fresh seafood!  We moved here from Virginia Beach and have had a hard time finding a seafood restaurant that meets our expectations.  This place did not disappoint!  Our server was helpful in deciding which items / how much food to order (the menu consists of small plates versus full entrees), and he coursed everything out for us.  The food came out quickly, and everything was delicious (and the mussels are HUGE)!  The wine menu is a bit confusing, but our server offered guidance based on my preferences and I enjoyed the selection he made.  The atmosphere of the (back) dining room is only okay (which is why I didn't choose 5 stars), but the service and food will bring us back again!

9EDUm-5k0j-vfD-muwhp7w.text: This place is solid. Par for the course for the restaurant group. My biggest complaint was the cocktails...they were "meh" in the taste department. I got the "secret magic" cocktail and my sister had the J-E-B ...I tasted both and neither were that great that we wanted to pay for another just "meh" drink. I have been to the Porter House twice and the drinks were awesome--just not here. We had the cheese plate, salmon and poke bowl, baked oysters and Brussels sprouts...all were excellent! I have never ordered a cheese plate st a restaurant before, but it was awesome! Pear chutney, apple butter, pomegranate/beet combo along with walnuts/bread and various cheeses-delicious! The oysters were awesome with bacon, leeks, cheese...amazing! The Brussels sprouts were perfectly cooked with bacon and some kind of glaze that any Brussels sprout lover would like. The poke bowl was more than enough to fill one person! Super tasty & the jalapenos on it were the best! I think they were candied...amazing! Service was good until it was time to get the back bill...but more good than bad!! So would come back.

8Bi53CKhd0r-62caTUCiMw.text: First time in Charlotte, here on business.  If it weren't for the tasteful interior design and crisp nautical color palette, I'd be giving this place a half-star.  By 7:30pm, middle of dinner service, they were already sold out of the most appetizing thing I read on the menu: lobster & truffles with basil shells.  It was the main reason I'd decided to try this place-having checked out the menu beforehand.  Ok fine, hot new restaurants sometimes don't plan well enough and sell out of their most popular dish.  So I changed up and decided to try the calamari and cauliflower gratin.  The calamari was a disaster.  Something about that hoisin-chili sauce it was cooked in  just didn't work.  And I can usually enjoy any type of calamari no matter how it's seasoned by different establishments but this I just couldn't.  I sent it back after two bites.  I decided to remain positive about the cauliflower and waited for that to come out and then I ordered the monkfish as my protein replacement of the calamari.  They both came out at the same time and neither impressed.  The monkfish was completely over-cooked and both dishes were so salty I can feel my body retaining water as it breaks down all the salt from that food.  I didn't finish either dish.  As a saving grace, Fin and Fino did send me home with a complimentary cheesecake since I didn't really enjoy my dining experience.  That's a nice gesture, it honestly boosts my view of their customer service-which is always appreciated...I just have no faith I'm going to enjoy it at this point. #saltychicagoan #literallysaltyfromsaltyfood

vfrRxdiJGaulQmGlLPFWfA.text: we went for restaurant week and got everything on the menu. It was all delicious! The dessert was surprisingly my favorite part! The scallops were amazing and the steak was great.

yJdS9Nq13ZuFxTz2gkSjuw.text: I have to say this was just awesome. Really just picked it on a whim and so glad I did. Couldn't be more happy with the choice. Everything about it.

HWxXaS6EhyUWEQNcnAJZqA.text: Great scene. Menu tries to be ambitious but food generally bland. Bar service good. Red wine selection leaves a lot to be desired. Food is small plates. Good selection of vegetables but quality and flavor marginal.

wyA4M7jDLlBCQ1Bo8jFq6A.text: This was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had in Charlotte . We ordered the Poke, ceviche , oysters, and BBQ quail . Each dish was fresh and flavorful. The service is excellent - our waitress Joanna was a sweetheart. I was very impressed and will certainly be back soon.

Oy7mwpGXO9_n4aFYLLAUew.text: It is fantastic to see the True culinary foundation of Charlotte growing with this Restaurant. There is finally a team in place that not only knows what is wanted, but what is needed to bring the True food scene to our City. I was lucky enough to be there on a day when the soup was a Lobster, sherry & saffron bisque. The wine list is inspired, the bar & Cocktails are unique, even the beers are well selected. Finally!

qea8hplxTzmXx-Cp2avFRA.text: I was very pleasantly surprised with this new uptown spot! The food was so fresh and creatively put together. I am typically not a raw oyster person but, the variety of the menu makes you excited to try new things all around! My service was immaculate! I felt that my server was ahead of the game! Every time I thought about needing something, he'd already put it on my table! In fact the service staff was attentive as a whole. They all seemed to be fully aware even of the tables around me. One thing that did throw me off was the huge contrast in uniforms between the servers and the bartenders. While they are all a nice-looking bunch, the bartenders wear a very fun denim outfit that looks carefree and comfortable. The servers however, wear white uniform shirts with aprons almost to the floor! It doesn't match the fun environment well. They just look uncomfortable in comparison but other than that (which is the absolute worst I can say) this place rocks and I'll be back as quickly as I can be!

9MFitKD04lhphhzWsdpOqw.text: I've had two memorable meals at Fin & Fino. Both times I did "The Treatment" and you should too.  Come with a larger group which will give you the maximum number of sampler items possible.   Service is beautiful here. You feel special and valued. This is a great location for special occasion, one of my visits was for my wedding anniversary.  The food is 4/5 stars, service 5/5.   Must trys include the oysters (raw and cooked) and the cheesecake. Cocktails are well mixed and the wine list is surprising, expensive and well-curated.

XtYIEH4QkaXZL3sdiLnelQ.text: This place was good but honestly not as good as I had hoped. We went for lunch and the service was absolutely amazing. The server was very attentive and accommodating. I had my young daughter with me and they made her a special meal since they didn't have a kids menu. It was grilled chicken breast with fries and fruit. It was very, very tasty and I actually liked it better than my own meal. My mom and I split an appetizer with was the Bahn mi shrimp. I love Vietnamese food so was very excited to try it. Unfortunate it just lacked those flavors that make a bahn mi so good. I just got a salad for my meal with was good enough but really nothing to write home about. My mom got the veggie pasta with shrimp and that too was just ok.  The real star of the show here was there wine selection. They have so many great wines to choose from. I did a wine sampler and I thought each wine was better than the last. I will be back again just to enjoy there wines but I'll probably pass on the food other than the occasional appetizer.

-E7zsI0-eRbHo18X8onL1w.text: I wish I could give this place 6 stars! Everything about our experience here was wonderful! We came in with a large group and sat in their private room. The server was very attentive and extremely friendly.  The drinks were great! I ordered a fun drink that came in a coconut. It tasted great and the presentation was adorable!  As far as the food goes, the oyster selection is to die for! We started with a couple of the Towers of Power, which were delicious! My absolute favorite dish of the night was the Angel Oysters (I can not recommend these enough!).  By the end of the meal we had tried over half of the menu. Everything was absolutely wonderful!  The only thing that wasn't exceptional was the lobster pasta dish, which wasn't bad, just very bland and not worth the price. Everyone in our group had a great time here! Cant wait to go back!

S8lhtzDcQMhYHHhVQNCsQA.text: Fabulous atmosphere! Fantastic bar! Super meal meals every time I have been, never a disappointment

Z9CM4wOo-uN3Fel6ng6_tA.text: Love the food and our server!  We love tapas so we ordered pretty much everything on their small plate menu.  Great and creative drink selections as well.  Perfect atmosphere for a casual business meeting.

RLk3cp6bn_HbnenqjNlxQw.text: My favorite seafood restaurant in Charlotte! A little pricey, but worth it.  Pros: 1. Fresh seafood - we had oysters, blue crabs, lobster tail, shrimps, and mussels. All of them are delicious. 2. Plates to share - most part of the menu is tapa style dish, so it is great to share with friends. 3. Friendly and helpful service. 4. Desserts are good add-on after all the seafood. Cheesecake is unique and tasty.  Cons: The only thing I found inconvenient is that the valet parking service does not start until 6pm on weekdays. Before 6pm, you can choose to park in front of the restaurant and give your keys to the front desk (then valet will park your car later), or just park in Duke Energy building ($5 after 5pm).  As for appetizer, I would recommend the tuna poke.

PNMu1dMFTfqpnU-stiAF1g.text: I came here for a work conference and was glad we were able to get reservations here The drinks were great, and the wait staff were AMAZING. Great customer service, excellent presentation, and spot on meal. Definitely worth going to for at least a drink. Excellent ambience also.

E4l2rPVa6LFWHqyRswGI9A.text: Love the small plates and delicious cocktails!  Service is impeccable. Beautiful atmosphere. It's fun to go with a group and order different plates.

ZeYD07vk0LhrILZicS5ktg.text: My husband and I grabbed dinner here before a show at Knight Theater. The service was very friendly and down-to-earth. The food (for the most part) was delicious. It took a little longer to get our food, especially our last two dishes, but all's well that ends well I suppose.   We ordered a couple of different oysters. I wish I could remember which ones so I could recommend them because they were delicious. We also did a beet salad and calamari, both of which were great! Our last two dishes, which oddly enough took the longest to come out, fell flat. It was the tilefish and grouper (which was the special). Both dishes were way over seasoned, we couldn't even finish them.   Still, the overall experience was pleasant, and we are excited to go back and try some more stuff. I also want to give it a try for lunch since I work just a few blocks away. Oh! And try the pineapple infused brandy! We got a small sip with our meal and it was really good.

kN_c2Cqv6osHr8RjjMxjWA.text: I can not say enough good things about this place. This is the destination of ever ladies night for my friends and I, who come from all around the city! The service is amazing. The cocktails are the best in the city. We always do "The call of the clam" for an always-late friend using things we know she likes to have the bartender makes something. They nail it ever time. The food is exception. It's fresh, different and always a little unexpected, but in a good way. Tip: Get the cheesecake. Save the room. You won't be sorry.

OUdS6vtj1cXsVih7zsgDsQ.text: Came to this restaurant for the first time last night for my friends birthday. We were very impressed. Great food, great atmosphere, and excellent staff!  Would definitely come back.

-GdyDZoxx4dWxPVmL0VWdQ.text: Treatment is the way to go. Although a bit pricey it eliminates the decision making from a pretty crowded menu. You can be very specific with what you want to try with the treatment and the chef will cater to your needs.

qnQNr0PshgUsPe8CsytbMQ.text: The service and food unfortunately did not impress. We had to send back the crab because there was little to no meat in the legs. I like the ambiance, but unfortunately the experience and the food were not worth the money in my opinion.  Edit: I should have noted that they did take the crab legs back free of charge and brought out a different option which was appreciated.

sByskZtuAJ1SfokbGqFrJw.text: Fantastic food and great service!  Let the chef take you on the tour of the menu, you will not be disappointed.

NElzppD69M9JEVw4S82yaA.text: I saw that Fin & Fino is doing restaurant week and seemed to have very good review so I went for my 3rd restaurant week dinner this week as part of my Charlotte trip.  Service was great at the bar (dining by myself so didn't mind sitting there).  There is an extensive IPA and cocktail list.  Cute concoction with a pirate theme in the name.  I went for the Booty.  Delicious.  From the restaurant week menu I selected Pork Belly to start (which is a special item that is not usually on menu), the Mahi Mahi with corn soubise and chocolate panda cotta for dessert.  I also took advantage of the special offer of $2 oysters and got a Shipwreck and a Miyagi.  Both were very fresh and creamy.  While service was very friendly it did take some time before the rest of the food arrived.  Pork belly as moist and flavorful beautifully presented.  It is just a touch off from being melt in your mouth but it was tasty so I am alright with that.  The Mahi Mahi was fresh but over salted (to the point I really couldn't enjoy it).  The bar staff was great - took care of it for me and let me reselect my main.  The Sea Scallop with andouille & maque choux redeemed it for me.  Big juicy scallops seared and seasoned perfectly.  I had chocolate panda cotta and hit the spot for me.    I would come back and try different things again if I had the chance.

0ezaF86yDw4yjV9_CLlF0w.text: Fin and Fino is a great restaurant. It has a modern and casual feel once you get inside the restaurant. The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous. The customer service in the restaurant was amazing. Our waiter knew the menu like the back of his hand which was very impressive. We went during lunch and the restaurant was not too crowded. At the first glance of the menu I noticed that there weren't any simple dishes and I am a simple lady. Everything seemed overly complicated but I am sure that is the purpose of the restaurant...differentiation from others. I ordered the tomato bisque and squash soup along with the salmon. I was sooooooooo impressed. The food was fresh and the salmon was delicious. Overall I think you should at least try this restaurant once. You won't be disappointed.

3QxROXEWYljbyyPf5-JPMw.text: The Dressler family... and not merely those folks that are blood related to John and Kim Dressler, who spearhead Rare Roots Hospitality (yes, I had such a good experience last night that I looked them up - and we were also fortunate to meet and chat with the very amiable John), but all those who are part of their familial-feeling company are all enthusiastic, professional, knowledgeable and better than all that, make you feel like part of the family as well while you are in one of their establishments. There are a lot of great restaurants and eateries in and around the Queen City; some are great most of the time, some are great on one thing but miss the mark just a bit on another, but rarely do you find a restaurant where every part of your experience is on pointe - from the service to the space to the offerings, the innovation in uniquely crafted cocktails and thoughtfully prepared plates that make you excited to venture out of your 'comfort zone' - every SINGLE time.  The Dressler's have found and kept talented, engaging people in all levels of their staff or 'extended family' so much so that nothing ever gets overlooked and exceptional is the norm.  You just don't find it done better than this - not even in New York, LA or Chicago. As you may have guessed, I am a fan of other Dressler ventures - love Dogwood Southern Table in Southpark and recommended Dressler's to a colleague who raved about his evening. I should have known the experience would be no less but completely different at Fin and Fino - a bright star tucked beneath the Q.C. Skyline. Our server Andrew (and I honestly hesitate to call these folks servers as titles can be misleading depending on where you work; these professionals are not the same level of staff that you might find at your local wing place or watering hole) was so adept (as they always are at a Dressler's establishment) at recommendations, noting our individual preferences and palates, that it would be hard to adequately describe the scents, tastes and sensations of the meal that we enjoyed last night.  Suffice it to say, there is something for everyone, and everyone will feel welcome and at home. Without describing each dish or cocktail (try their sherries, you will be delighted and may find a new hobby!) I will just briefly note that the extensive list of oysters, the creative small plates and unique spirits were all memorable in their own right but were an epicurean symphony together. Make a reservation - you don't want to miss Fin & Fino.

Av5LyQnyHdPUfzsaiU95AQ.text: Absolutely phenomenal! My table of five got The Treatment and it was so much food all the way to dessert. Our server Ryan was another reason our experience was unforgettable. He was so genuine and had loads of personality! Great delicious restaurant!

YGF3AUlK2I8nGda3bP1aWg.text: This place is amazing as its sister, Dogwood. The plates were all impeccable, and sauces were "lick the plate" good. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves quality food! The small plates varied in sizes, for prices reasonable for sizes ($11-$15ish.). 3 people split 4 plates and we were plenty full.  I would recommend to anyone to go... and look forward to trying their "Treatment" tasting.

ZznOcbHKK3gX4rkp88LJpQ.text: My husband and I came here on Saturday for a date night. The first thing I noticed was how gorgeous it was inside! The space is well designed and super appealing.  We sat down and immediately decided on the Treatment. $55 per person and $5 goes to charity. They bring out a sampling of things on the menu. Additionally, we decided on a bottle of wine. We found out that the wine we selected was out of stock but the waitress handled it well by suggesting something comparable and bringing us a tasting of it.   Side note: I thought they handled my husbands oyster allergy (yes, just oysters...it's odd) really well and were super conscience of it.   As for the food.....absolutely delish. It just kept coming and coming. Here is what was brought out for The Treatment: -Oysters- For me. I got two and I loved being able to compare the flavor profile -Bahn Mi Shrimp- Nice sized and flavorful -Salmon and Tuna poke bowl- The rice had a great texture and the tuna was so good -Mussels- The sauce was insanely good. They even brought out extra bread for us to soak up the amazing sauce.  -Fried Calamari- This was the only miss for me for the whole night. I felt like the breading was just a bit too thick so all you tasted was fried-ness -Scallops- The latke underneath was a nice touch. So flavorful and perfectly cooked -NC Trout- Probably my favorite of the evening. Squid ink pasta....need I say more.  -Tilefish- The saffron aioli was so tasty. This was another winner! -Cheesecake- So light and fluffy -Brownie- The cherry filling was not too overpowering which made this perfect combo of flavor and texture.   I cant wait to come back just to try the Lobster and Truffles!  I think my only complaint was that the portions were huge. For The Treatment, I wished they served a bit smaller size since we were getting so many. However, now that I am typing this, I feel like I sound ridiculous!!   Service was absolutely flawless. I truly haven't been so happy after a meal in a long time. This place is the real deal.

OpVUGqRUyPA16PjiP31WWg.text: I  people. visited fin & fino twice in the last few months.  Both occasions have been amazing.  Brittany runs a very on point cocktail haveprogram and Eli hands down gave me the best service I have received in Charlotte.  It's also a pleasure to see a very hands on owner working in the kitchen.  Great food and drinks and great

_qPDYM0GiE_7GGnSoHDroQ.text: I've been to Fin and Fino (F&F) three times now and as someone who's been to every seafood spot in CLT, I can say this might be the top seafood restaurant in Charlotte.  Here's why Fin & Fino might be the best in the Queen City...  Ambiance:  In the sake of full disclosure, I should mention I've only sat at the bar @ F&F.  Its usually not crowded and one can usually find an unoccupied spot or two at the spacious bar without any issue.  The open feel of Fin & Fino is really inviting.  The white tablecloths help to create a more upscale, classy feel for sure.     Food:  Every foof item I have sampled at F&F has been super tasty, and prepared with attention to the colors and appearance of the food on the plate.  The calamari, though slight different with the radishes was awesome!   The hanger with the kale and beets was also a variation on your standard hanger steak, but was excellent as well.  The PEI Mussels are a must as well - I would order the mussels simply for the buttery broth they are served with!  Just like the rest of the items, you don't get a big portion, the colors jump right out at you but the smell and taste are too inviting to resist.    Service:  The service has always been excellent.  As mentioned earlier, I've been here three times and do not have a single complaint about the service.  Everyone has always been super friendly.  I can't imagine you having any issues with the service (although as stated, I've only eaten at the bar while dining here).  Parking:  They have complementary valet parking, otherwise Uber.  If you like seafood and you haven't been to Fin & Fino, I've got to say you are def missing out on what may indeed be the best seafood spot in all of Charlotte.

EnralGTuClSfJzI2RyJZxA.text: Fin & Fino is a fun spot to come and grab some food, particularly for anyone working in downtown Charlotte - it seemed quite popular on a weeknight for folks to stop by and grab some food and (more popularly) drinks. It's got a pretty casual vibe to it nonetheless, with a bar to the right as you go in and some high-top tables to the left. There's also a dining room further back as you go in, but we ended up sticking to the front while we were there. The service at the bar is pretty straightforward and attentive, but I did feel that after we moved to a high-top table, it took a little longer for the waiter to check on us, particularly on the beverage front. The food, however, came out in a much quicker and orderly fashion.  Overall, I'd say that I probably liked the food better than the drinks; the house cocktails were okay, if a bit on the simplified side, i.e. it didn't have the same kind of depth to the beverages that you'd find at a cocktail lounge. Nonetheless, they were still solid, and I was more impressed by the beer selection, which is pretty broad and has a solid selection of local brews as well. The food here is a little more skewed towards the seafood, but I really enjoyed everything I ate here. The oysters - whether raw or grilled - are quite good, with a nice geographic selection to choose from if you go the raw route. I also quite liked the steak that was on the menu here; it was served sliced up and cooked to a really nice medium-rare with a lot of flavor.  With a wide-ranging menu of food that's done well without trying to be overly complicated, Fin & Fino is a nice spot to come for a quick drink, some bites, or a full-blown meal. Given its accessibility to the heart of Charlotte, it'd definitely be a place I wouldn't mind coming back to next time I am in town.

QWPHLecAIgID4vj_EtMnPg.text: The Treatment was amazing. So many great dishes and they just kept on coming. This location used to be E3 and I mourned the loss of the lavender foam drink I used to have there when it closed, but Fin & Fino is a very welcome alternative with custom cocktails that display bartender skills beyond your everyday stir and shake.  I loved the drink I had and I wish I could tell you what it was, but they made it for me based on my tastes and I had no idea other than it was pretty deadly, pretty and deadly. YUM!  I can tell you, once they brought it to me, everyone else at the table wanted one. It was so good!  Chris is the best server in the place! Loved how he teased my friend about her eyebrows - that added some entertainment to go with the fantastic food.

G2qjxdlOc6hKckjGoPt89Q.text: Had the best night at the bar courtesy of Rebecca! She made the most amazing Mai Tais for us and selected exceptional options for our "Treatment". I will most definitely recommend this to friends and be coming back soon myself!!!

P3hdyB15EUulkzz8S7k4Ug.text: Good food, great server. The ambiance is nice and the menu offers something for all diners. Presentation is wonderful. Will definitely be back to try other dishes.

H06ig6deJXrXSWEK7mNKGA.text: We had an amazing Friday night dinner at Fin & Fino.  We started the evening out with a couple of cocktails - both were very tasty.    We asked the server for "The Treatment" -- and what a great decision for our first time at Fin & Fino.  The dishes (all small plate/tapas) began arriving!  We had grilled oysters - the smokiness was outstanding, scallops on latkes, lobster gnocchi, mussels, tuna and salmon poke, fried calamari and finished the evening with a cheese plate (we requested no sweets).  Everything we had was delicious - the standouts were the scallops, mussels and poke.    The Treatment is $55/person - essentially, your server is selecting a number of items that fit within the price range of what you are spending - 2 people = approximately $110 worth of food.  I would recommend The Treatment for your first trip - but, next time I will just select a number of plates on my own.  Service was outstanding.  The venue is clean and white (if a bit sterile feeling).

FhCrRqiFB9sH53Y1OHUsiA.text: What a Wonderful experience. I'm coming back tomorrow  Oysters. Lobster and truffles so good. The drink specials are also great.

amRZjS5U928ZF0n6DIxv8g.text: Thoroughly enjoy this restaurant. Been twice, only at lunch and food has been top notch and service too. Friendly wait staff, attentive, good quality food. Crab cakes are fresh tasting, not too much breading. Decor is nice, airy/light feel to it. The Dresslers have done it again! This will be a place I will take out-of-town guests, for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. The salad offered with fried goat cheese ball and added crab cake

UAQQyV1xORay5mGxyYuGAA.text: Been for dinner and for lunch and I am impressed. In a city with a dearth of seafood spots this one not only gets it right with the food but also with the atmosphere, service and overall experience.   Our waiter at dinner was nothing short of superb. He quickly got the idea we were in a playful mood and played right along, making it a fun evening but still provided spot-on and professional service. His recommendations proved reliable. We ordered The Treatment and our waiter did custom wine pairings for us. Not just for the table. He customized the wine pairings based on each person's individual preferences. That's some good stuff, right?  Went back for lunch on a hot day and the AC was really struggling. They need to address that. With that said, the Poke Bowl was far superior to any I have gotten anywhere else in town. Great flavor, texture and reasonably priced.   They also have a great bar and craft cocktail menu.   This is the latest concept from the Dressler restaurant group and I think it may be their best yet.

MPYmXeIhnxbVioundm0Dvw.text: Another in a long list of places I've been wanting to try but haven't gotten to previously.  Fortunately a work team dinner paved the way to finally try Fin & Fino.  Outstanding is the first word that comes to mind after the experience.  First off, any place that serves a lot of small plates automatically gets off on a good foot with me as I love variety in most all things but particularly when it comes to food.  Now, that is just the first step and if the small plates don't deliver, well...  Fin & Fino delivered and then some.  The beauty of a dinner with a team you're very close with is, sharing!  I was able to sample not only what I ordered but a bunch of other items as well.  Plus, a seafood tower was ordered for the table and just happened to land right in front of me which did not suck at all.  I ate, I shared, it was heaven.  The tower featured chilled oysters, mussels, shrimp, crab claws, salmon/tuna poke and lobster and it was all fresh and just delicious.  The cocktail sauce that came along with it was potent to say the least and I'm a lover of that horseradish kick.  Other things I was able to sample... BBQ quail, hot mussels with yummy broth, mahi, other kinds of raw oysters than what came on the tower, creamed crab and oysters (hot dish) and gnocchi.  It was all well prepared with the last two dishes listed being good but not as great as everything else.  Service from the middle of the table to my right seemed to be great but I heard the next day there were some issues at the other end of the table including hints of condescension coming from the server when some wine was sent back.  I didn't see or hear so not first hand but, I trust the sources.  End of the day, I came home raving about F&F to my wife and can't wait till we go back.  Thank you to the Dressler family for another CLT restaurant winner!

C2TJ1nYwDWccabI4wdiEew.text: This place is very classy. A special occasion spot. I'm a huge oyster lover and I've had oysters from Miami,LA,San Diego and Manhattan but these were by far the best oysters I've ever had I'm very spoiled now lol! They even have little sauce injectors with different hot sauce anywhere from sweet to spicy which I think is brilliant! We ended up get the 2 tiered seafood platter as well omg wow! Everything was fresh and to die for! The Rose was at a perfect temp and they had a great selection of wines! Truly a remarkable place! It is very pricey but well worth it this is why I would call it a special occasion or holiday place unless you can afford a $500 bill every night or week if I could I'd be there a few times a week absolutely worth every penny!

rmMiGWfifLlJQQT3c2cPhQ.text: One of my favorites. I highly recommend "The Treatment" which is like allowing the chef to take you on a surprise trip around the menu. Be sure to share your favorites so they can ensure the dishes selected are what you enjoy most -- mine is seafood!! I'm not a fan of dessert so, I was given charcuterie in place of the sweets (be sure to inform your waitress early).

Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

J1x_RkkPCYCfniljcYySfw.text: I'm tired. I'm exhausted. Andrew lead us down a fantastic culinary voyage culminating in a simple and clean three course meal that satisfied every possible flavor profile you could dream of. Excellent wine, excellent service, excellent food. I feel a tad spoiled, a little sweaty- but I couldn't be happier. Thanks for making our wedding anniversary peculiar and special. Love you, Andrew.

TCJ37GZ4ObE113h9f5GzkQ.text: 3.5 stars.  My husband and I visited Fin & Fino for the first time recently to celebrate our anniversary.  We live close to Dressler's in Huntersville, and it's become one of our favorite spots for fine dining.  We had hoped to have a similar experience at Fin & Fino.  It was close, but not quite.  We each had three dishes - two sides, and four "entrees."  As this is tapas-style, your dishes will come out as soon as they are ready.  We started with the blistered tomatoes.  Honestly, this was my favorite dish of the night.  The tomatoes were cooked perfectly, and the dish had a good quantity of melted mozzarella and fabulous homemade gnocchi.     Next, came the scallops & latke and the lobster & truffles.  We preferred the scallops over the lobster.  The scallops and latkes were perfectly cooked (the latkes a little crispy), and the creme fraiche sauce was a nice complement.  The lobster was served with basil shells in a cream sauce.  The salty cream sauce drowned out much of the flavor of the small bits of lobster, and I couldn't taste the truffles at all.    Next, we received the wagyu skirt steak, shrimp with buckwheat tagliatelle, and cauliflower au gratin.  The wagyu was the biggest disappointment.  It was cooked perfectly medium rare, but had almost no flavor.  The shrimp tagliatelle was the most generous portion.  I really liked the light sauce, but the pasta was a bit overcooked.  The cauliflower was very good, but heavy with the cream sauce, and a bit salty.  We both had cocktails - I had the Good Sister (I think that was the name), and my husband had the #9.  They were good, but pricey.    Service was the star here.  Our server was very helpful and attentive, and we never wanted for anything.    Would we return?  Maybe, when they change the menu.  We had several very good dishes, but overall, I wasn't as impressed as I had hoped I'd be.

IQqLuHo7YI7NOZkJ_G8Zkg.text: I had a wonderful time and the food was great! The restaurant is beautiful! I didn't know whether to sit at the bar or get a table! There are plenty of items to choose from on the menu and there's even valet parking. It's also in a great location downtown so you could grab a meal, then go see the sights of Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie board
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet mignon

iOG1N_SD7WR5nx2ov88lIg.text: Oh my word, FINALLY CHARLOTTE. You have delivered and Fin & Fino did not disappoint.   Justin didn't have high expectations walking in, but something inside of me did, and we both left so thrilled with our experience from start to finish.  We weren't able to get reservations since we were last minute walking home and decided to pop in for dinner, which was fine, because the bar was perfect for us and it was totally meant to be because Rebecca, the bartender, was knowledgeable, kind, soft spoken, attentive, just asked enough questions, and took pride in taking care of her guests. I haven't had service experience like this in a long time and coming from the industry myself, it was so welcomed.  We split the Tower of Power. Looking back, we should have probably done the smaller tower and ordered the hot mussels because J didn't love the cold ones (but I did). We were *slightly* disappointed in the oysters on both taste and size, but over all were very happy.  We are so excited to visit again and try other dishes...and of course, sit at the bar.  The open concept of this space is gorgeous, airy and light. Love the kitchen windows and the cleanliness and the decor. It's the perfect date-night spot on all levels.

rWfV6AJH4s4kaM-3OlOqpQ.text: I've visited Fin and Fino twice now and both times with a group.  It's the perfect place to meet and literally share a dinner.  The menu offers a wide variety of seafood all super fresh and flavorful.  I love the open kitchen -the sound and smell is amazing.  I particularly enjoyed the mussels and the wine list.  The shrimp pasta is really good.  The red snapper special with house made gnocchi was amazing!  The service is also top notch.  We had a very minimal wait and for our troubles the manager provided our table a cheese board which was fantastic it even had French salami which was new to me and very delicious. If possible, save room for dessert. This last time I tried and loved the hazelnut creme brulee.   I definitely plan on returning to feast on their yummy seafood creations!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie- Thanks!

Sv8STejt1OxEuiTLyPCXJg.text: Interior decorating is tastefully nautical with the decor above the bar - hanging seashells - and soft hints of blue and white.  Bartenders were spectacular - friendly and helpful in providing recommendations and crafting cocktails. If you love beer, they have a great craft list with beers I've never seen anywhere else in the city. One notable one was the key lime gose. As the beer started to warm up, you could taste hints of graham cracker. The wine list also looked great! Rebecca was great! She made a point to learn my name for the next time I come in.  Happy hour special 4-6 was Parmesan fries, a burger and one other sandwich item for under $10. All of the plates (for the most part) seemed shareable. You could go with a few friends and split 3-4 different dishes to sample the assortment.  The vibe was a mix of date night, girls night out and business people.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Truffle Mac and Cheese

Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels

54Wy9yFnhwnzotFbPPROTg.text: Delicious food and great service. We had a party of 8 and everyone agreed on 5 stars. I had calamari, scallops and roasted cauliflower - all fabulous. Everyone got something different and enjoyed everything. The waiter was helpful, knowledgeable, attentive, quick. Our only complaint was that it took a while to get our first drinks - after the food was delivered to the the table. I had a Pinot noir, which was really good. 2 glasses of wine plus my food was $100 with gratuity. Expensive but highly recommended.

FfcC91V3EBCqLAFbT1WEHw.text: Exceeded our high expectations. Entire staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. We got a selection of raw oysters from east and west coast. Very fresh and a nice selection. House sauces were very good. The lamb was tender, flavorful and garnished beautifully. The salmon was also excellent with a wonderful presentation. For desert don't miss the olive oil baked pound cake pieces covered in berries and whipped cream. Definitely will be back.

N8bzp7l6Bcy_7onDuMHGbQ.text: Revisited Fin & Fino for a second try during restaurant week and came away very impressed. The service was exceptional. One of our items took a little longer than normal (because the place was packed) and the manager didn't charge us for the food. They also gave us free glasses of wine.   The first time I went to this restaurant it felt overpriced. This time the amount of food was more proportional. I will definitely be coming back to try out more items!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tower of power

5kRr1pGxGf_PQiNp0WGNQg.text: Great oysters and service! Waiter was very helpful and confident. A tad pushy but it helped pick the perfect dishes to try. My drink was a bit strong but who's complaining? I'm not!  The atmosphere was nice and prices were reasonable. I ordered the two buck chuck oysters, calamari with curry aioli, and the porterhouse medium rare. It was a bit under cooked but they were able to cook it up to a perfect medium rare! We took a chance sending it back but were happy with the outcome! I'll be visiting again.

Kwy9ABU5REtgCvASDV8zmw.text: This place is a classy seafood restaurant in uptown's thirdward that is swanky, but approachable with contemporary maritime decor.  We got The Treatment, which is a  multi-course culinary journey through the menu; basically a delicious metaphorical ship captained by your server as he guides you through each delectable dish's portofcall and honestly the way to go here. It's steal at $59; it is a personalized small plate extravaganza that will trigger every tastebud. All of the dishes were amazing!  They have a great cocktail list and the cognac & gin based Doo Wop was more than just a pretty drink; it packed a punch!  They have some great oyster options and serve them deliciously; chilled and on the half shell with droppers of different vinegars.  Staff and ambiance were great! Really enjoyed the full "treatment"!  So, if you're in the mood for some innovative #seafood you gotta #trythischarlotte   They also offer valet prkg starting @6pm during the week & @5pm on Saturday!

Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

d3O0MK-rCS4vKvnKIIkdNw.text: My friend booked reservations at Fin & Fino for a small group last week. The restaurant is pretty large and the front faces out to some patio dining. It's quite loud in that area and I was happy that our table was towards the back of the restaurant, which was much quieter.   Our server, Devon, was hilarious and so fun. We hit it off with him right away. I was thrilled to see a section of non-alcoholic beverages, but Devon told me about one that wasn't yet listed, which was a strawberry spritzer. That was my choice and it was like summer in a glass. Perfect!   To start, we shared the calamari. It was okay, certainly large enough for sharing but it didn't blow me away. What did blow me away was our shared lobster and truffles dish. WOW. This was so rich and so delicious. A must order.   I will say, the menu is a bit confusing. We were told the plates are meant for sharing but they were all on the fairly large side! We ended up each ordering our own plate and then trying tastes of each other's dishes. I had the tagliatelle with shrimp. This was really good and just what I was craving. My friends were happy with their salmon and octopus dishes.   Everyone was too full for dessert but somehow we convinced ourselves to take desserts to go. And you better believe I was super pumped a couple hours later in my hotel room with my giant slice of cheesecake! Said cheesecake was the final nail in the coffin of gluttony that was my three night trip to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry spritzer (one of the alcohol free options) - delish!

-JXOLD1KhPBCfHZewO6eng.text: Loved being able to try out Fin & Fino before heading out of Charlotte on this latest business trip. My co-worker was able to get us a reservation for the evening a few hours in advance and when we arrived the restaurant was very busy with both outdoor and indoor seating. It's located right next to the seesaw art installation right now and made for a lovely walk.  At this point I wasn't really drinking as much so went with one of their non-alcoholic cocktails and it was absolutely delicious and not too pricey. Going to start paying attention to this section of menus more thanks for Fin & Fino. For my entree I decided on the Octopus dish and wow I loved it! I will say that make sure you are a fan of Octopus if you order it, as it comes out a little tender/little tough just like is should be. I also loved the pork shoulder, salad and dipping sauce that it came with.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

0mqOz2r2Fe2NdOpOERsc3A.text: Quickly becoming a favorite!!  The ambiance is wonderful, the service great and the food delicious. If you like seafood, and are looking for a good food experience in uptown, come here!  Both the shrimp and lamb dishes with the home made tagliatelle are absolutely delicious. The mahi mahi is on point with the wild rice and fennel sausage. The flavors are unique, but they go together oh so well!  They have a tasting menu option and that's what I'm going to try the next time around; given that everything I've had so far has been really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. RAS EL HANOUT LAMB LOIN, the shrimp tagliatelle and the mahi mahi!

a6MU5ZAhLlWtoKwNUaxPrQ.text: If you're going to experience Fin & Fino, you've got to do it right. Hands down the best way to do that is The Treatment. For $59, let your server and the chef take you on a tour of the menu. Bonus: $5 goes to charity. If you're thinking that sounds a little too pricey, it's not. You'll want to order several small plates here (tapas style dominates the menu), so it's actually the most cost efficient to do that.  The best thing on the menu is the lobster & truffles. Housemade basil shells, lobster stock, celery root brandade, truffles- you can taste just how much love and work goes into this dish. It's so delicious. I've tried a lot of things on the menu (I'm a big fan of The Treatment), it's all been great. My latest trip here, we weren't hungry enough for a huge meal so we just shared a few things. We got the calamari (the curry coconut dressing on it is very tasty), Buckwheat Tagliatelle, Octopus & Pork Belly, and the faroe Island Salmon. Loved the beet puree with the salmon and the fingerlings were to die for.   Service was amazing, it always is here. It's the same group behind Dresslers, Dogwood Southern and The Porter's House, so I always know it'll be a great experience. I love the decor, atmosphere and vibe. The restaurant opens out onto the patio. The space is clean, white, and bright. Super gorgeous.  They have free valet here (right in front of the restaurant on Levine Avenue of the Arts). There's also the Duke Energy parking deck.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rosè

ttK_7B675G3wyVXHYUMKUw.text: Ordered Fin & Fino for their weekday takeout dinner special. For $20, you get a salad and an entree. My options for salad were arugula and goat cheese or mixed greens with beats. My entree options included: sirloin, salmon or tagliatelle pasta with added shrimp.   In theory it sounded like an amazing offer, especially for uptown but I will say that the portion sizes were slightly disappointing.   Aside from that, the food and its quality was amazing! I chose the arugula salad with salmon. The salad was fresh and the salmon was cooked to perfection. It also came with potatoes and ground meat.   Pickup was easy, although the restaurant was crowded. They seemed to be having a corporate mixer or gathering. After heading to the bar, my food was ready with compostable silverware included.   All in all, I will definitely be back again! I would not suggest if you are ravishingly hungry but it was enough to satisfy me - and the food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

fTiGB4eYMdWS3h0XsxeoPw.text: Of all the dining experiences I have had recently, Fin and Fino has topped the list. If you do decide to go order the treatment. It is a wonderful tasting experience where your waiter customizes several courses based on your preferences. I enjoyed the suspense of wondering what dish would come next and we were completely stuffed by the end.  First I must mention that there was a disappoint aspect to the experience. THEY NO LONGER SELL THE DRINK IN A PINEAPPLE. Which I suppose is ultimately a good thing because their bartender completely revamps the beverage menu periodically but I must admit I was a little disappointed.   Our excellent waiter who was prompt and full of warm personality started us off with oysters. My fiance had them raw and I had them cooked. The raw ones came with an impressive assortment of sauces in eye droppers for exact distribution. Then we moved on to the poke bowl, which I could have happily eaten as my entire entree. Delicious sauce, generous fish portion. Several other small plates later we had the fish special of the day accompanied by the beets (outstanding beets) and roasted cauliflower (with bacon, of course). I will say the waiter originally brought us the fried okra which neither of us were big on and when he saw we hadn't eaten much happily swapped it for the much better cauliflower with no prompting. So if something on the tasting isn't to your preference they will swap it out!   Just an all around great experience and we will definitely make the trek from the burbs to the city to return!

K9V2xII2tD98ZnmRpSNTdA.text: Fin & Fino really delivered on service, food, and atmosphere. Everything is made in house and is served tapas style (but some of the dishes are much larger than a tapas).   The raw oysters are very fresh and served with house made crackers on request.  The buckwheat tagliatelle was really good (better than the risotto).   The snapper dish was very good also.   For dessert I recommend the strawberry shortcake with toasted/cubed olive oil cake

TnZz335wxTGgbWFaMmT8fQ.text: We had a farewell lunch for a coworker here.  We decided to share food so we can try them all.  For starters, we had fresh oysters, which was so good!  We then had a charcuterie board, without cheese like most restaurants, but it still turned out great.   Their lunch special was swordfish on risotto which was amazing!  We also had the steak which was ok, fries that came with it was pretty good! The poke bowl was delightful!  Great place for lunch!
