mEyZPy35Go4JUFY6ts1eaA.text: Wow! Where do I start! A friend celebrated her birthday here and it happened to be restaurant week. Three of us decided to get the Queen's Feast meal...BAD IDEA!! It was awful! I understand the idea of tapas but this was poorly executed. The feature on the QF website was extremely misleading because we ended up sharing every course besides the "entrees". Only the appetizers were large enough portions for THREE PEOPLE. The vegetable and dessert was literally enough for one person, two if one is a child. I thought maybe we were unlucky for participating in QF. However, I was wrong because no one in our dinner party enjoyed their food. Everything was lacking flavor. The final straw was the QF dessert! It's literally the only picture I took because I could not believe my eyes. Literally 3 of the smallest desserts I've ever seen in my life for THREE grown adults. Absolutely ridiculous. The only good thing this place had to offer was drinks so if you must visit this place, grab food elsewhere first.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

P2SNWyirT1_oG_C1_qIgpA.text: I have to say I was really looking forward to this place. Seafood? yes... uptown? yes... it had all the markings of a great seafood spot.   Let me begin by saying that the location is great and the space is wonderful. We went for a special lunch out with some family, which I think is where I went wrong. The menu is completely different for dinner - the lunch menu caters to the working uptown bunch (which 95% of the people were when I went). Not much fin or fino on the lunch menu. I did take a peek at the dinner menu and it seemed a lot more my speed and what I was expecting from the restaurant. I'll certainly have to give it another try at dinner time.   The food was okay, ordered a round of oysters and they were fresh as can be, the mignonettes were outstanding, all done in house. The calamari was a salty...the tomato bisque and the salad were fine. The crab cake sandwich had a little too much bread for my taste, but it had good flavor and consistency. We ordered a risotto and it was tasty but not very creamy and too al dente.   I think the best part of the meal was the service, our server was exceptional and though I think I was having a difficult time with some of the menu items, he was excellent.   Again, will have try to make it to dinner.

zJD5toTZZmeBiETF4LRpUQ.text: I've been looking forward to checking this place out for restaurant week.  We were celebrating a friends birthday.    We were seated quickly and the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous.  The decor is beautiful.  We were brought waters and ordered drinks.  It took a little while to get our drinks but we were talking so we didn't mind.  Delicious bread was brought out to the table.  Two of us ordered from the restaurant week menu and the others from the regular menu.  The gnocchi was by far the best I have ever had!  The salads were fresh and delicious.  My husband got the oysters and said they were amazing.  For our main courses we had scallops, lamb, and salmon.  The scallops were good but the slaw didn't taste good with the dish.  I would order it again with no slaw.  The salmon and lamb was delicious.    For dessert we had the cheerwine pound cake and brownie.  The staff brought our desserts to the wrong table and let them sit for 5 minutes and then talked about it in front of us, grabbed them and put them on our table.  I asked to get new ones from the back and the whole thing was bizzare.  It took about 30 minutes to get new ones.  No one apologized.  This is the only reason I didn't give fin and fino 5 stars.    We will be back again for sure and hopefully will have a smoother ending to the night.

Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

2k8PW3_4NCytizj5WGE_DQ.text: Ideal location across the street from the Knight Theatre.  Upscale.  Swanky.  Hip.  Everything one has come to expect in Uptown.  The restaurant is beautiful, done in light colors; not a dimly lit joint with heavy decor.  I ordered the mussels as many of my Yelp pals suggested.  Excellent smoky flavor and softly steamed meat.  Well done.  Interestingly, as others have noted, their calamari misses the mark in different ways.  For us, they were very salty and overcooked with just a smidge of smoked aji aoli.  Disappointed.  We would return considering F&F a welcomed restaurant in Uptown.  I say "give 'em a whirl" and decide for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tender and smoky mussels.  Delicious.

xEUX3iWc10lC9-rQN-Vsiw.text: If I'm going to go anywhere for a great food experience. It will be here.  I had the lobster and truffle pasta. And I must say that it blew my mind so much that I had to continue to come back three more times just to experience it. I highly recommend that anyone try it, although I would suggest getting in the old fashion on the side to complement the dish.  The wait staff to the hostess have been nothing but pleasant it. And I most certainly appreciate them. I most certainly appreciate, the suggestions of what we should drink while pairing with a meal. I will always come back to finish female because they have my heart. I can't wait to eat more of their delicious truffle and lobster pasta.

S2yr_oNWnzNOxoqOqZxHRA.text: Pros: Valet Wait staff was very knowledgeable and all around friendly Food was amazing - great flavors Got the "call of the clam" drink - basically you tell them what liquor you want and a word and they make your drink. It was amazing! Very cool and clean looking ambiance.  Not too noisy even though it was busy.   Cons: Portions are very small.   I had a great experience at Fin and Fino. It lived up to its expectations and I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States

E_A6KDszsf2r1oMUjtS9yw.text: We had a lovely New Years Eve dinner at Fin and Fino. I knew it would be good since it falls under the same umbrella of restaurants as Dresslers, and I love that their specialty is seafood. The service was fabulous and every meal and drink was delicious. We chose to have the bartenders surprise us/make our own cocktails based on our preferences ($15/each), and though it's a steep price, they were right on, although mine could have used more ginger beer :)  It's a small plate atmosphere/tapas style so plan on ordering multiple plates. Better yet, go with a group so you can try multiple things. We started with the beet greens salad and calamari. The calamari was very unique and different from any other calamari dish I've had, the curry-coconut dressing was a major hit and win in my book. I also liked the daikon and pickled carrots and cilantro additions. We went with one of the seasonal pasta specials, which was also delicious. I would also recommend the mussels if you like those as well. Overall, delicious food, quick service and wonderful and romantic setting. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fin & Fino - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamri

mgn5CTKRTb10O_BExkOT0A.text: I finally got to cross this place off the list. I got to try a lot of the menu items and was pretty happy with all of them. The mussels were  my favorite, because I love mussels. I ordered extra bread for the remaining sauce and it was delicious. Calamari was crispy as it should be and good, although I wish there were less of the whole pieces. I despise them.   The salmon was so salty, that we had to send it back. I hate doing that, but I just couldn't eat it. The staff was super nice about it and brought another one very quickly and it was indeed better. The service was great. The server was prompt and attentive. The manager came out to check on us and that was a personable touch.   It's a beautiful location and the atmosphere is bright and warm. I liked it!

5BnvAQm0fsuyxn-2OzApeA.text: Went for lunch and enjoyed the Poke Bowl.  Added some soy sauce (does not come with it)to the rice for additional flavor. Service is friendly and efficient and the restaurant was full for lunch.  Bar area looks great and will have to try it the next time I am here. Reasonable prices.

YQogF3VAArvH-wMitlEaiA.text: Best seafood restaurant in Charlotte by far and we've tried them all! Amazing customer service. Chris was awesome! When you go do the dealer's choice with a little guidance up front via "The Treatment" part of the menu and you won't be disappointed plus it's for a good cause.

Nm2wPKubBmRMqNVuus35CQ.text: My husband reserved this restaurant for my birthday. We had a lot of people and they did a great job accommodating us. Natalie was amazing ensuring all our guests were happy. Our waitress, whose name I can't remember (it was the awesome drinks) was great too. Keeping a group 22 isn't an easy task. She did a great job. Now on to the food. Amazing. The drinks were great too. Overall such an amazing experience I'd recommend them to anyone wanting to have a celebration with good food. Thanks fin and fino!

kgQ6VYmAzzlL5P3t0PzPNw.text: The chefs is the way to go. They accommodated my food allergy so easily. Our table of 5 all had the chefs special (the whole table should do it together for the experience) and it was delicious. The food was amazing, the service was exceptional, and the ambiance was perfect.

ki14uJnhE7YoGh7zNUEvjA.text: Big fan of this place. The crab cake BLT with pork belly and green tomato relish was perfect. Not to mention, all sandwiches come with a light side salad, delicately dressed with a citrus vinaigrette. Well done guys, well done!

mYunLYFnJkZvwNMLCp416w.text: What a great spot! Went here for dinner this afternoon, and boy did I have a great experience. Not only did I network with other people, I also enjoyed the food, drinks and atmosphere! I will soon become a regular, especially for your good girl/bad girl drink and banh mi shrimp!

434GtarFoZdU1KrsRJRIZg.text: Just left restaurant week and the food was amazing . I had the shrimp appetizer and the scallops . Every single bite of food I had was delicious . Our server Culp ? was great and very knowledgeable about the menu items . I will defiantly be back soon !

Xs6T7rJ24PnX-ZZGycGLOg.text: I seldom write reviews for restaurants. I am writing this review for Fin & Fino because I feel that the dining experience was spectacular! Our waiter Tyler P. Completely made the experience for us. I was so impressed by the customer service experience and the delicious Chefs Menu. I recommend this restaurant and specifically Tyler P. For your waiter. The wine selection is wonderful as well!

UH8Tu1EamCXG5CwHjq6IPA.text: Wonderful place! Service was on point. Beautiful restaurant. Of course Dresslers has become the great standard in this city. I had the Wagyu skirt steak. My guest had the Faroe Salmon. We will be back

vG99YOxQN8n3DbT_8Gsb0g.text: Excellent food & service.  Absolutely one of the very best dining experiences we've ever had.

CsdlPZ5dGcQjpoUoVL39Yg.text: Loved it! We often struggle with where to go to experience nice, crisp and inviting seafood. Today we found it. Fin & Fino was spectacular. The  Treatment is the way to go! Chef's choice and a range of options. It was enough for two, and then some. Icing on the cake is that dessert is included. Hands down one of the best new places we've tried. I also love that their cocktails are inspired by 90's music. Beautiful decor, moderately upscale feel, without the fuss.

VOPRjZ5CGs-9IrBsVn6B-w.text: My wife and I had a wonderful dinner on Friday evening. Will was our outstanding server. He's recommendations were perfect. Andrew was his serving partner and also was spot on with our wine choices. The food was delicious. We will most certainly be back.  The owner,Jon Dressler stopped by our table. It was a pleasure talking with him.   Great job!

3sDlc0l8pdcm5Xhp4F8v3Q.text: Very lovely interior, friendly and good wait staff and delicious food...Even when the kitchen forgets to put key ingredients in the dish.  There seems to be very many/too many in the kitchen so maybe they are getting in each others way?

_jQgNNU4byMrsrub5G6ckQ.text: This place was phenomenal! Spent the day exploring Charlotte with a group of friends and were all starving. We tried "the treatment" which is an interactive pre fixed designed by your waiter. With a great and interesting conversation about tastes and preferences our server Chris curated and amazing meal with more plates than I could count. The scallops were the best I have ever tried and the mussels beat that. Our waiter was the far and away the highlight of the dinner, he knew the menu in and out making selections that impressed the entire table. If you're looking for a dinner you'll remember please try Fin & Fino (and ask for Chris).

yuMNgxKRAb94GWnjprPDfg.text: The $55 Treatment is NOT the way to go!! We would've paid less just purchasing the items. The server pushed 'The Treatment' for dinner and said it would be a way to taste different items and they would bring more of the items we liked. We received a lot of food, some we liked and others we would've never ordered. The server never came back to ask if there were items we would like again. Total for The Treatment Option was $220 and if we would've just paid for the food brought to the table we would've only paid $174.  So, we lost $46 plus the added tax and tip gratuity. Total the table spent around $400 for food and drinks.  Lobster truffles, smoked salmon, poke bowl, and Moms Cheesecake was delicious!  I love scallops but they were salty. The other items were ok. The restaurant is beautiful and makes you feel like you're at the beach!

LEzCCOLe45YFg4bGiUhUNw.text: After reading the reviews of Fin and Fino we decided to come here for a birthday celebration.  Upon arriving at the restaurant the wait staff did not ask if we had a reservation. We were left standing for 5 minutes until we were seated.  No one came to greet us until one of the host came over with water after another 10 minutes saying our waiter will arrive shortly. Not impressed with how I was treated because they are known for their "service".  We ordered grilled shrimp and baked oysters and both were delicious. However, our flank steak was overly charred and bitter. Risotto was undercooked and salty. Overall we're not overtly impressed with this place which was a huge disappointment.

mgztDXNrGo2vkna935xweA.text: Had been eyeing this place for a couple months, always like to see a new seafood spot in Charlotte.  Fin & Fino did not disappoint from start to finish.  Best oyster selection I have seen in QC, cocktails are phenomenal, and each dish, seafood or not, was great.  My favorite was the creamed crab and oyster dish. The olive oil cake was also incredible.  Service was also very friendly (Boston).  Nice ambience, will definitely be back.

I9DwS7P0sFi2q0GP3J2aWg.text: I walked into the restaurant only because it was convenient on a warm worrisome night of weather on Good Friday.  It was right across the street from the Knight Theatre where I planned to see one of my favorite bands, Hiroshima.  I had some time to kill before the show so it was perfect. My male server at the bar was attentive, courteous, and helped with my menu selections.  The food was good.  Of my three selections, grilled shrimp, oysters, & shrimp flat bread, the grilled shrimp was my favorite.  As I prepared to leave, I had a major nose bleed.  I was so shocked!  I can't ever remember having one as an adult!  The look on the server's face as he noticed what was happening was priceless!  He hurriedly passed me a number of towels, then stepped way back!  A customer, Jeannetta (a friend of an off duty employee), who was also seated at the bar, helped me to the bathroom.  Right behind her was another server Rebecca who stayed with me, while another server came in with advice & gauze.  Jeannetta, who had left the bathroom came back with more information on nose bleeds.  As I got it together & prepared to leave Jeannetta walked me to the door.  I looked over toward the bar & the male server waved goodbye! He made me smile!  Thanks so much to Rebecca & her co-workers for looking after me. I thank God that kindness still works in America!!  Fin & Fino has some top notch folks working for their business!  Customers too!  Thanks Jeannetta!!  Fin & Fino, I'll be back!!  Finally, the show was great!  Classic!  Hirsoshima has been in the business for 40 yrs and still going strong!

ijw5BOqsofZYNR0POeojZw.text: By far the best server I've had in a while, and I know a some of the crew from Dresslers/Porters House (and those guys are always great), however, the food left a little to be desired. Best dish of the night was the grilled oysters with bacon and jalapeno. Worst dish of the night was a neutral split between the duck and the fried oysters.   The cheese plate (since we were ordering to split between 2-4 people for each dish) had enough bread for one of the cheeses only, and to be 100% honest, I expected better cheeses.....it was a very boring medley of blue, manchego and cheddar.   The shrimp bahn mi was a disappointment as well. Expected a True bahn mi style dish.....I understand the deconstructed(ish) approach, but with something quintessentially bread based, it needs to have some kind of component that relatively mimics the name. Or just simply change the name to Vietnamese style shrimp.  The chilled lobster tail was okay...not great. Just a plain jane, cooked lobster tail....with nothing on it.   The two constructive criticisms on the two worst dishes. Just lose the fried oysters.....the oysters you have are great....I suspect that the oysters you're frying are an exceptional way to get rid of the dated ones. Unfortunately, it kinda tastes that way too.....like the dish was an after thought.  The duck.....most places in Charlotte have a similar problem cooking their duck. The fat cap isn't scored, and the fat isn't slowly rendered off.....leaving a giant jiggle of fat under the seared bit. Not appetizing, and the rest of the dish was exceptionally bland.   Having said that, the calamari was stellar. The beet salad was good too. Would give it a second go at some point to check it out again. The good items were VERY good.....

niH-4-Myrj_Ya77pGQmFmA.text: Last night we were served what I would have to call one of the most amazing, innovative, and delicious meals that I have ever experienced! The service was sublime! The food was unique and exciting! And the atmosphere was warm, welcoming, and enjoyable! We started with a monstrous platter of oyster shooters which my nephew declared as "creamy and buttery", LOBSTER & TRUFFLES with basil shells, pasta cooked perfectly al dente with a hint of shaved truffle was to die for, a bowl of mussels in a broth that we were soaking up with a wonderfully crunchy grilled bread, and an andouille and blistered tomato flatbread perfect for those of us who needed something other than the shellfish! We then ordered a smorgasbord of delights including the GRILLED BANH MI SHRIMP, SALMON & TUNA POKE bowl that comes with sushi rice, pickled jalapeno, and greens. The fried CALAMARI with smoked aji aioli, pickled peaches, and herbs was perfectly cooked with a slightly sweet, slightly spicy sauce drizzled on the plate to drag through. The STUFFED QUAIL was stuffed with andouille bread pudding, shishito, foraged mushrooms which melted in your mouth. We doubled up on the SCALLOPS & LATKE as suggested by our very knowledgeable and extremely attentive waiter so that everyone in our party who wanted had their own portion. It was well worth it!  We enjoyed the  HANGER STEAK served over creamed leeks, zucchini, and pickled red onion and the FRIED OYSTERS were a sweet surprise! Lightly breaded and golden brown, one bite full of flavor. The HARMONY RIDGE DUCK BREAST with smashed potatoes finished off our own selections, again perfectly cooked to a medium as asked, juicy and tender.  As if that wasn't enough, our ever ready waiter suggested that we sample a newly created dish that he felt was often overlooked on a menu with so much to offer and a taste treat not to be missed! The GRILLED TUNA in a dashi broth, with eggplant, smoked tomatoes, fried parsnips. He was correct! It  was sushi grade tuna perfectly cooked and the dashi broth was full flavored and briny. The pop when you bit into the whole cherry tomatoes gave an acidity that balanced with the oils of the tuna and the crunch of the parsnips enhanced the texture of the dish. Hats off to the wonderful sous chef Kordecki, who we were told created this amazing combination!  A mixed platter of yummy desserts and coffee sealed the deal that we will be coming back for many more adventurous and delicious meals here!

kdE9agRTuwzs4XRBDs0UZQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere, great service and food that comes out of that kitchen is miraculous.  We came in the Tuesday after they opened and have been back twice since.  It's cool that I'm not from Charlotte and when the bartender sees me automatically reaches for the 18yr old Macallan I drink.  The oysters are the best I've had outside of New Orleans.  Beautiful ambiance, great service again, and I also got to meet Anthony Hamilton one of my favorite R&B singers.  The art district is lovely in Uptown as well.

0ioTiihz36erWXaqjf0jeQ.text: We ate here before seeing the Symphony Magic Of Christmas next door at Knights Theatre. The place was filled. Glad we had reservations. Willie was a fantastic server without being over the top annoying. Our drinks only took a couple minutes to receive and food was record time. Some of the best I've had in Charlotte. Dessert was exquisite. Looking forward to going back often.

LiKnYsVPf3eh4EMQDpxJbQ.text: I went for the latkes. The scallop is perfectlyCooked and the latke was not greasy at all.  That being said I just really didn't like it that much It just was lacking in flavor but it was original and something fun to try. The bar staff was really nice and I found of the location to be nice, upscale and I felt very safe and welcome they're being from out of town.

3tEIzuLPoDJSQ1lwf_UcIA.text: Update: 7/21 Sanitation Rating up to 96.5!  Update: 5/16 Sanitation Rating is up to 90! Going to give Fin & Fino another try. Fingers crossed!  88 Sanitation Rating not posted near the primary entrance... surprising for a brand new establishment. Food was good and fresh but the serving sizes could have been larger for the price. Same with the mock-tail I ordered. It was tasty and came in a cute cup, but it was mostly ice. Will try again IF the Sanitation Rating improves.

BJAggo7xfo5x2wutX9hsyg.text: Great decor and big bar.  Bartenders are great. We always sit at bar and food is mostly great.  Recently we got the shrimp flatbread and were VERY disappointed.  It was dry flatbread (no sauce). With tasteless shrimp and some peas shoots.  So bland and boring.  Other than that item we love this place.

LogVNLmUOAZ7-bdjt0T-MQ.text: What a pleasant surprise ! The restaurant was just opened a week ago.  We opted for "The Treatment ", which is a Chef tasting menu.  Flavor was crisp and clean.  The food portion was generous and the waitstaff was very attentive.  The over experience was just excellent.

pXyoCQQW09Guc5i4KwvUCQ.text: Amazing restaurant in Charlotte. It is by far the best seafood I have had here in Charlotte. I will definitely be a regular here. The bar area is very pretty and the ambience was really nice. The roasted tomatoes with gnocchi are a must. Along with the angel oysters, grilled with bacon and jalapeno. What a great combination. The cocktails were ok. Tried the booty, it was a bit fruity. I would opt for wine next time.

mXMGt6SNy2oN791Qc1ittA.text: We went here on a whim and happened to get a seat in the bar area - which turned out to be good because we were a tad underdressed for the dining room.   The food. Was. Incredible. Our server, Nick, was fantastic and overall I would give 6 stars if I could. We ordered cocktails and I got the "call of the clam" in which you choose your "spirit and direction." I wound up with a blueberry vodka drink and it was perfect!   We each had three oysters and it was very cool to be able to pick from all kinds of regions. Liked all three.   This place is billed as "tapas" but we only ordered two dishes - with the intent of ordering more - and thank goodness we didn't. The two plates were plenty for us. We got the Trout and the Poke bowl and they were phenomenal. We never would have ordered trout if it weren't for Nick's suggestion and it was The pasta was cooked to al dente perfection, to the happiness of my Italian fiance. The pesto on the trout was the perfect balance to the squid ink pasta and we practically licked the plate clean. The poke was just as delicious and the perfect balance of salty and savory flavors. Overall we were to thrilled. Can't wait to come back!!! Thanks, Nick!!

ZRZ1vlCcJqHTC84Y52Bc9A.text: We dined here with a group for a birthday. We were super excited as this was our first evening out in Charlotte and the "sister" restaurants had great reviews. The food was mediocre. And nearly everything is served as tapas style so in order to have a full meal, you're ordering 3+ dishes at $13+...just fell flat. We literally ordered 1-2 of everything because the portions were so small. My husband enjoyed the steak as his favorite. For a seafood place I was really disappointed!! The ahi bowl was decent but tiny serving for the price. Flatbread was boring and nothing to remember. The gnocchi had oysters, but again very few! We ordered a dozen raw oysters and 2 of the 4 I had were not good. My favorite, by far was the cauliflower! So if you're a vegetarian go for a light snack/appetizer and get the cauliflower. Otherwise, this is not necessarily a restaurant I would recommend or return to dine again. So sad, because I'm a pescatarian and was hoping to find a new favorite seafood spot!

O7gleQLgHIoJB2V3Qyo1FA.text: I had a great experience at Fin & Fino.  The restaurant itself is beautiful!  The drinks and food were also very good and pretty reasonably priced considering it's a seafood restaurant in uptown Charlotte.  The bartender was very helpful and informative.

nMLLQuqbmD7yIqCGoIa2vg.text: Great food!!!! The Treatment is a tasting menu for $50 can't lose!!!!!! On negative is they don't carry Patron Tequila

XJWXs7IQoMfwC69Y_bVnig.text: Our favorite restaurant since moving to the Charlotte area. Fun, eclectic restaurant with drinks as creative as the food items.  Our server, "Boston" as her fellow staff members call her, was excellent. She knew the menu well and made the perfect recommendations all evening after asking us the right questions to discover our tastes.  The creativity extends from the bartenders and the drinks they mix all the way through the menu items. We were also amazed how reasonable the prices are for the quality of the food.  Highly recommend!!!!

0wJVGKTr_xLdLV83hrjAMw.text: We went during restaurant week with large group. They just recently opened and we were unsure how things would turn out.  We should not have feared. All dishes that came out were well presented and flavorful.  Similarly service was attentive and corrected mistakes quickly.  We also sampled many drinks and wines and walked away similarly impressed.  Definitely a spot worth revisiting.

SUk5gIGkTw4CLaT09mXjyw.text: Best meal I've had in charlotte in a long time. And the best service too. Not sure where to start because everything was amazing. We had the cauliflower, quail, mussels, lobster pasta, mahi, oysters, and the berry crisp. Each dish was perfectly balanced and flavorful. Our waitress was amazing which made it so much better.

1v0s43E6hWBurz18Ro76Lw.text: World class meals every time yes it's True this place is great wonderful and terrific. The service is awesome and the food is even better.The enhanced level of food quality is unmatched and the Queen City has a lot of catching up to do. Best seafood restaurant ever.

6CYXC-27PV28IWGLERvxBQ.text: First let me say that I have been wanting to come here since they opened. I was REALLY looking forward to this dinner. As soon as we walked in the door we noticed the low health score of 94. Not what you want to see at a seafood restaurant. The hostesses did not look as polished as you would expect...think hair/clothes/makeup. The ambiance was nice, the service was just ok and the background 80's music has got to go. We came here for Valentines Day with a pre-set menu for $99 per person (drinks not included). The craft beer list is amazing and my cheddar something drink was very good. First our starters came out, the pork belly was good but the squid ink gnocchi was fishy and lacking flavor. They forgot our soup/salad course until we said something. We shouldn't have said anything...could have skipped this course all together. Onion soup was too sweet and salad was nothing special. Next our entrees....I can't believe I am saying this but they literally recycled food/sauces from the starter course. The octopus was mealy, fishy and came with the same kale mixture from the gnocchi and sauce from pork belly. The porchetta was the same piece of meat as the pork belly and came on top of dry lentils. I think the base sauce of the lentils could have been the same as the kale mixture....not sure. We did not bother to eat more than two bites of each meal. We took the desserts to go which ended up in the garbage after we tried them. Overall this was an extremely disappointing experience and we feel cheated to say the least. Our total bill came out to just under $300....this was not money well spent. Charlotte is filled with so many great restaurants, I doubt we will go back. This was not the experience I was expecting to have from Fin & Fino. :(

qc07-n92OHIKmIyFhhsIsA.text: Great food and even better service! Very nice atmosphere. Definitely recommend. Big oyster selection

4LyM0GtkBkItIH-Tz9xWZg.text: Great culinary experience!  Had lunch and was mildly disappointed at how thin the lunch menu was. I had looked over their dinner menu last night and was intrigued by about a dozen dinner menu items. The dinner lineup looked so good that I needed to explore Fin & Fino immediately. So, lunch.  Beautiful, uncrowded decor! Service that was friendly and very competent!   Quick note; I don't get the name... Fin and Fino, what does that mean?  For lunch I selected 4 things 1. grilled Bahn Mi shrimp app, which was flat out spectacular. Served six perfectly grilled, decent sized shrimps. Cut these in half and had 12 ideally sized bites. Whatever it is they grill these things over, it gives the shrimp succulent, smoky char-grilled flavor. When you combine the pickled daikon/carrots, sriracha aioli, and popped sorghum onto your fork with a shrimp bite you'll have a nice sized, delicious bite. From start to finish, each bite was a wonderful taste treat! 2. soup of the day was shrimp gumbo. You could tell that this was a long, slow savory journey from cutting board till ending up in my bowl. Marvelous flavor, marvelous kinda-spicy seasoning, marvy aftertaste! 3. unsweet ice tea is something I'm particular about. Boom! Nailed it. brewed just right ... not sitting in a pitcher of melting ice for a long time before I ordered it ... refills were timely and delivered in a fresh glass ... Delicious Southern tea, just normal tasting, made like it's supposed to be, delicious tea! 4. half dozen raw oysters. The oyster menu is hidden in a separate menu that is really the drink menu. I never would have found them if I hadn't asked. The dinner menu is chock full of oysters. The St. Simon ones I had were elegant, sweet, wonderful looking (but undersized) oysters. Killer house-made sauce BTW! Also, Killer house-made crackers!  A re-visit to Fin and Fino for dinner is in my future

U7hjhaUlo9jCuewCLfo_RQ.text: Absolutely delicious. And the tasting menu was worth every penny!! I will definitely be back. Oh, and the drinks/cocktails were great too. I had the "good sister" and it was so refreshing.

8uQzjVD7WJxtgIjMhD3ENw.text: The food was fantastic but our server - Chris(from Concord) made the dining experience worth going back for!  His personality was the perfect fit for our group and his knowledge of the menu was excellent !
